main_definition: Delegation refers to the act of assigning responsibility or authority to someone else, as well as a group of representatives sent by an organization or individual to attend a meeting or conference.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Assigning tasks or responsibilities to another person
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager delegated the task of preparing the presentation to one of her team members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people chosen to represent others at a conference, meeting, or event
meanings_and_examples.example: The company sent a delegation of its top executives to attend the annual tech summit in Silicon Valley.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Transferring authority and responsibility from oneself to another person
meanings_and_examples.example: As he was unable to supervise all aspects of the project due to his busy schedule, he delegated some tasks to his trusted colleagues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act or process of transferring authority and responsibility from oneself to another person
meanings_and_examples.example: Delegation is an essential skill in leadership as it helps distribute workload and empowers team members.
